<English>: When researching all modifications at each tier, you will receive bonus RP for the vehicle being researched in the amount of {bonus}% of the sum of RP spent on researching all modifications of that tier.
New hydraulic boosters improve the plane's maneuverability.
Checking, tweaking, and regular maintenance of the compressor increases maximum engine power, boosting acceleration and top speed.
Checking, tweaking, and regular maintenance of the compressor increases maximum engine power, boosting acceleration and top speed.
Cleaning of the radiator and cooling system makes engine cooling more effective.
Replacement of worn engine with a new one, increasing acceleration and top speed.
Replacement of worn engine with a new one, increasing acceleration and top speed.

Replacement of damaged airframe elements increases the plane's overall durability and flight performance due to weight reduction. For some planes, this means that you get a new plane with an undamaged airframe.

Replacement of damaged airframe elements increases the plane's overall durability and flight performance due to weight reduction. For some planes, this means that you get a new plane with an undamaged airframe.

Replacement of damaged airframe elements increases the plane's overall durability and flight performance due to weight reduction. For some planes, this means that you get a new plane with an undamaged airframe.
Regular maintaining of cover and replacement of damaged cover parts increases the plane's overall durability and flight performance due to weight reduction.
Replacement of damaged elements of fuselage skinning, removal of openings, and surface finish to reduce air drag.
Replacement of damaged elements of fuselage skinning, removal of openings, and surface finish to reduce air drag.
Replacement of damaged elements of wing skin, removal of openings, and surface finish to reduce air drag.
Replacement of damaged elements of wing skin, removal of openings, and surface finish to reduce air drag.
G-Suit makes it easier to carry high G-loads, allowing the pilot to sustain high-G maneuvers for longer periods of time before losing consciousness.
G-Suit makes it easier to carry high G-loads, allowing the pilot to sustain high-G maneuvers for longer periods of time before losing consciousness.
Manually-activated fire suppression system which enables the aircraft to put out engine fires.
Automatically-activated fire suppression system which enables the aircraft to put out engine fires.

Electronic Countermeasures System consisting of countermeasures dispensers with provisions for flares and chaff. Flares confuse infrared-guided missiles, while chaff confuses radars and radar-guided missiles.

Electronic Countermeasures System consisting of countermeasures dispensers with provisions for flares and chaff. Flares confuse infrared-guided missiles, while chaff confuses radars and radar-guided missiles.
Allows the installation of external Electronic Countermeasures pods. These pods contain dispensers with belts of chaff, which confuses radars and radar-guided missiles.

Missile Approach Warning System which alerts the pilot when a missile has been launched at their aircraft. The MAWS will display the missile's approach vector on the aircraft's RWR, and has a configurable option (toggled ON by default) which will automatically dump countermeasures upon detecting a missile.

Missile Approach Warning System which alerts the pilot when a missile has been launched at their aircraft. The MAWS will display the missile's approach vector on the aircraft's RWR, and has a configurable option (toggled ON by default) which will automatically dump countermeasures upon detecting a missile.

Allows the installation of Pylon Integrated Dispenser Stations; these are ECM pods which fit onto the aircraft's missile pylons and contain provisions for chaff and flares. Flares confuse infrared-guided missiles, while chaff confuses radars and radar-guided missiles.

Missile Approach Warning System which alerts the pilot when a missile has been launched at their aircraft. The MAWS will display the missile's approach vector on the aircraft's RWR, and has a configurable option (toggled ON by default) which will automatically dump countermeasures upon detecting a missile.

Allows the installation of Back-Of-Launcher countermeasures pods; these are ECM pods which fit onto the aircraft's missile pylons and contain provisions for chaff and flares. Flares confuse infrared-guided missiles, while chaff confuses radars and radar-guided missiles.

Allows the installation of Back-Of-Launcher countermeasures pods; these are ECM pods which fit onto the aircraft's missile pylons and contain provisions for chaff and flares. Flares confuse infrared-guided missiles, while chaff confuses radars and radar-guided missiles.
